alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 11 at 9:33PM CST until further notice by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... North Platte River at North Platte affecting Lincoln County. .An ice jam will cause water to infiltrate the lowlands along the river. For the North Platte River...including North Platte...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...North Platte River at North Platte. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Minor flood stage. Minor flooding begins in low lying and agricultural areas along the south bank of the North Platte River. Flooding of yards between the golf course and Buffalo Bill Campground are possible. Minor water intrusions into low lying areas of Cody Park in North Platte begins. People should use caution in the water and along the banks of the river, especially near Cody Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CST Thursday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain near flood stage tonight and Friday but additional rises are possible this weekend and beyond. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 100 PM CST.
